member.name: T:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILExceptionHandler
member.summary: Provides mechanism for exception handling in wrapper. It handles both synchronous and asynchronus error. To handle asynchronous error, you must register the client class to the event

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILExceptionHandler.MILExceptionHookHandlerFunction(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: This method is being called when a MIL Exception occurs

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILExceptionHandler.ExceptionHandlerTestCall(System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: This method allow us to call the private method MILExceptionHandlerFunction. We need to call it in some unit tests and we use reflection to call it. We do not call directly MILExceptionHandlerFunction because for the parameter MIL_ID it throws an ArgumentException.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILExceptionHandler.FireAsyncDelegate(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILExceptionInfo)
member.summary: Method called to fire the event of a MIL Asynchronous exception

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILExceptionHandler.RegisterMILCall
member.summary: Method used to register a call so that when MIL reports an exception, we will be able to differentiate is the error was synchronous or asynchronous. If we omit to register the MIL calls we do, every MIL exception will then be treated as asynchronous exception.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILExceptionHandler.CheckForMILError(System.String)
member.summary: Method used when we called a MILFunction to check if there was an error during the call. This is to be used with synchronous MIL calls.

member.name: E:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILExceptionHandler.OnAsyncMILException
member.summary: Event raised when an async MIL exception occurs.

member.name: T:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.UnallocatedMILResourcesException
member.summary: This exception is throw when a MIL object is not freed at the end of the application. The exception message contains a call stack where each object had been allocated.

member.name: T:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILAllocationVerifier
member.summary: This class provides the means to monitor allocations of MIL objects and report an error when objects are not freed. Usage : Set the property to true to monitor MIL object allocations. When an object is not freed, a is thrown.

member.name: P:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILAllocationVerifier.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not MIL object allocations will be monitored. Typical usage of this property is to set it to true in Debug configurations. The default value is false.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.M3dmapAddScan(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,System.Int64)
member.summary: Extract laser line data from an image and store this data in a 3D reconstruction result buffer.
member.param: Specifies the context identifier of the 3D reconstruction setup.

Specifies the identifier of the 3D reconstruction result buffer in which to store or clear laser line data. The 3D reconstruction result buffer must have been previously allocated with M3dmapAllocResult of type M_LASER_CALIBRATION_DATA, M_POINT_CLOUD_CONTAINER, or M_DEPTH_CORRECTED_DATA .
Specifies the identifier of the image buffer containing the grabbed image of the laser line.
Specifies the identifier of the image buffer containing the intensity map.
Reserved for future expansion. This parameter must be set to M_NULL .
Specifies the label of the point cloud in the result buffer in which to add the laser line data.
Specifies the function's control flag. This parameter must be set to one of the following values:

member.summary: Compute the transformation that aligns two point clouds.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of a pairwise 3D alignment context, allocated using M3dmapAlloc with M_PAIRWISE_ALIGNMENT_CONTEXT .
Specifies the 3D reconstruction result buffer of type M_POINT_CLOUD_CONTAINER that contains the point cloud(s) of the model.
Specifies the point cloud(s) in the specified 3D reconstruction result buffer, or the entire result buffer itself, that represents the model.
Specifies the 3D reconstruction result buffer of type M_POINT_CLOUD_CONTAINER that contains the point cloud(s) of the scene.
Specifies the point cloud(s) in the specified 3D reconstruction result buffer, or the entire result buffer itself, that represents the scene.
Specifies an alignment result buffer or 4x4 transformation matrix used to prealign the model before the pairwise 3D alignment process begins.
Specifies an alignment result buffer or 4x4 transformation matrix used to store the results from the pairwise 3D alignment process.
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT .
Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the 3D alignment status of the model on the scene.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.M3dmapGet(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT@)
member.summary: Retrieve the world coordinates and intensity of each of the points in one or more point clouds.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the 3D reconstruction result buffer from which to retrieve the points or features. The 3D reconstruction result buffer must have been previously allocated with M3dmapAllocResult using M_POINT_CLOUD_CONTAINER .
Specifies the point cloud(s) in the specified 3D reconstruction result buffer.
Specifies the feature to retrieve from the point cloud(s).
Specifies options for the function.
Specifies a combination of two values: the depth and type of the arrays.
Specifies the maximum number of elements that the output arrays can hold.
Specifies the address of an array in which to store the first coordinates of the feature to retrieve.
Specifies the address of an array in which to store the second coordinates of the feature to retrieve.
Specifies the address of an array in which to store the third coordinates of the feature to retrieve.
Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the number of elements written in each of the output arrays ( Coord1OrPackedArrayPtr, Coord2ArrayPtr, and Coord3ArrayPtr ).
member.returns: The returned value is the number of elements to be written in each of the output arrays, regardless of whether the arrays provided are big enough to actually write the elements. When using M_NO_INVALID_POINT, this is the number of elements after filtering out the invalid points.

member.summary: Store world points inside an unorganized point cloud.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the 3D reconstruction result buffer in which to store the points.
Specifies the label or index of the point cloud in which to add the points.
Specifies the feature (coordinates and/or intensities of points) to add to the point cloud.
Specifies a combination of two values: the depth and type of the elements in the arrays.
Specifies the number of elements in each non-null array.
Specifies the address of an array containing the first coordinates, or a packed array containing all the coordinates, of the feature to add.
Specifies the address of an array containing the second coordinates of the feature to add.
Specifies the address of an array containing the third coordinates of the feature to add.
Specifies a calibrated MIL object whose relative coordinate system is used to express the given 3D points.
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT .

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.M3dmapSetBox(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Set the extraction box used for depth map extraction.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the 3D reconstruction result buffer in which to specify the extraction box. The 3D reconstruction result buffer must be a point cloud container, which means it must have been allocated on the required system using M3dmapAllocResult with M_POINT_CLOUD_CONTAINER .
Specifies the type of box to set.
Specifies how the extraction box is defined.
Specifies the X-coordinate of the first point used to define the extraction box, or specifies a MIL identifier used to define the extraction box.
Specifies the Y-coordinate of the first point used to define the extraction box.
Specifies the Z-coordinate of the first point used to define the extraction box.
Specifies the X-coordinate of the second point used to define the extraction box, or the length of the extraction box along the X-axis.
Specifies the Y-coordinate of the second point used to define the extraction box, or the length of the extraction box along the Y-axis.
Specifies the Z-coordinate of the second point used to define the extraction box, or the length of the extraction box along the Z-axis.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.M3dmapSetGeometry(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Define a geometry object, either parametrically or by fitting it to a depth map.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of a geometry object.
Specifies the type of geometry object to define.
Specifies whether to define the geometry object by explicitly providing the coefficients of the geometry's equation or by applying a best-fit geometry operation on the depth map.
Specifies information about the geometry object used for the operation.
Specifies information about the geometry object used for the operation.
Specifies information about the geometry object used for the operation.
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT .
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT .

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.M3dmapTriangulate(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Triangulate the 3D world coordinates of points from their pixel location in the image plane of two or more cameras.
member.param: Specifies the address of an array containing the identifiers of the camera calibration contexts for each of the camera setups.
Specifies the address of the array containing the X-pixel coordinates of the common points in the image plane of each camera.
Specifies the address of the array containing the Y-pixel coordinates of the common points in the image plane of each camera. This array must have a size equal to ( NumCalibrations x NumPoints ).
Specifies the address of an array in which to write the calculated X-world coordinates.
Specifies the address of the array in which to write the calculated Y-world coordinates.
Specifies the address of the array in which to write the calculated Z-world coordinates.
Specifies the address of the array in which to write the root mean square (RMS) error for the calculated world coordinates of each point.
Specifies the number of calibration contexts. This should correspond to the number of cameras. This parameter must be greater or equal to 2.
Specifies the number of points to compute using triangulation. This parameter must be greater or equal to 1.
Specifies the world coordinate system that is common to all the specified camera calibration contexts.
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT .

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.M3dmapTriangulate(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.IntPtr,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Triangulate the 3D world coordinates of points from their pixel location in the image plane of two or more cameras.
member.param: Specifies the address of an array containing the identifiers of the camera calibration contexts for each of the camera setups.
Specifies the address of the array containing the X-pixel coordinates of the common points in the image plane of each camera.
Specifies the address of the array containing the Y-pixel coordinates of the common points in the image plane of each camera. This array must have a size equal to ( NumCalibrations x NumPoints ).
Specifies the address of an array in which to write the calculated X-world coordinates.
Specifies the address of the array in which to write the calculated Y-world coordinates.
Specifies the address of the array in which to write the calculated Z-world coordinates.
Specifies the address of the array in which to write the root mean square (RMS) error for the calculated world coordinates of each point.
Specifies the number of calibration contexts. This should correspond to the number of cameras. This parameter must be greater or equal to 2.
Specifies the number of points to compute using triangulation. This parameter must be greater or equal to 1.
Specifies the world coordinate system that is common to all the specified camera calibration contexts.
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT .

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.MbeadDraw(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,System.Int64,System.Int64,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,System.Int64)
member.summary: Draw specific features of a bead context or of a bead result.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the graphics context to use. This parameter must be set to one of the following values:

Specifies the identifier of the bead context or bead result buffer that this function will use to perform the drawing operation. The context or result buffer must have been previously allocated on the system using MbeadAlloc or MbeadAllocResult, respectively.
Specifies the identifier of the destination image buffer or graphics list in which to draw.
Specifies the drawing operation to perform.
Specifies the type of points that this function will use to perform the drawing operation.
Specifies the templates (one or all) that this function will use to perform the drawing operation, or specifies that you are performing a general type of drawing operation.
Specifies the set of template points (one or all) for which to perform the drawing operation, or specifies that you are performing a general type of drawing operation.
Specifies whether MIL performs drawings with fail-type points differently than drawings with other types of points.

member.summary: Free a bead context or a bead result buffer.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.MbeadTrain(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,System.Int64)
member.summary: Train the templates in a bead context.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the bead context that contains the templates to train.

Specifies the identifier of the image buffer containing the training image with which to train the templates, or specifies to train the templates without a training image (or with a previously saved training image).
Specifies whether to save the training image ( TrainingImageBufId ).

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.MbeadVerify(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,System.Int64)
member.summary: Verify beads in the target image according to their corresponding template.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the bead context that contains the templates with which to validate the beads in the target image.

Specifies the identifier of the target image buffer that contains the beads that must be verified, according the templates contained within the bead context. The image buffer must be a 1-band 8-bit unsigned buffer.
Specifies the identifier of the bead result buffer in which to write the results of the verification.
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT .

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.MblobAllocFeatureList(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID@)
member.summary: Allocate a blob analysis feature list.
member.param: Specifies the system on which to allocate the feature list.
Specifies the address of the variable in which the feature list identifier will be written.
member.returns: The returned value is the feature list identifier if the allocation is successful. If allocation fails, M_NULL is returned.

Specifies the address of the variable in which the blob analysis result buffer identifier is to be written.
member.returns: The returned value is the result buffer identifier if the allocation is successful. If allocation fails, M_NULL is returned.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.MblobAllocResult(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Allocate a blob analysis result buffer.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.MblobCalculate(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID)
member.summary: Perform blob analysis calculations.
member.param: Specifies the blob identifier image that will be used in calculations.
Specifies the grayscale image (not a binary buffer) that will be used to calculate grayscale features.
Specifies the identifier of the feature list buffer, previously allocated with MblobAllocFeatureList, that specifies the feature(s) to calculate.
Specifies the identifier of a blob analysis result buffer, previously allocated with MblobAllocResult, in which to store calculated results.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.MblobControl(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,System.Int64,System.Double)
member.summary: Control a blob analysis processing control setting.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the blob analysis result buffer.

member.summary: Draw specific blob features in the destination image buffer or graphics list.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the graphics context to use when drawing. This parameter must be set to one of the following values:
Specifies the identifier of the blob analysis result buffer from which to retrieve the features to draw.
Specifies the identifier of the destination image buffer or graphics list in which to draw.
Specifies the type of operation to perform.
Specifies the label of the blob or blobs to draw.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.MblobFill(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,System.Int64,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT)
member.summary: Draw blobs that meet a specified fill criterion.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the blob analysis result buffer.
Specifies the identifier of the destination image buffer.
Specifies which blobs to draw with the specified value.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.MblobFree(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID)
member.summary: Free the blob analysis result buffer or the feature list.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the blob analysis result buffer or feature list buffer to free. The buffer must have been successfully allocated, using MblobAllocResult or MblobAllocFeatureList, prior to calling this function.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.MblobGetLabel(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT@)
member.summary: Get the label value of a blob at a specified position.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the blob analysis result buffer where the labels are stored. Note, this function cannot obtain the label values of blobs that have been deleted from the result buffer with MblobSelect .
Specifies the X-coordinate of the blob.
Specifies the Y-coordinate of the blob.

Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the label value. If there is no blob at the specified location, the blob has been deleted, or if the blob's XPos and YPos lie outside the original identifier image, M_NULL is returned instead of the label value. Also, since MblobGetLabel returns the label value, you can set this parameter to M_NULL .
member.returns: The returned value is the label value of the specified blob.

member.summary: Read the pixels along a specified arc, count the pixels, and store their values in a user-defined array.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the single-band (monochrome) source image buffer.
Specifies the X-coordinate of the ellipse center, relative to the top-left coordinate of the source buffer.
Specifies the Y-coordinate of the ellipse center, relative to the top-left coordinate of the source buffer.
Specifies the radius along the X-axis. The radius should be given in pixels and must be greater than 0.
Specifies the radius along the Y-axis. The radius should be given in pixels and must be greater than 0.
Specifies the angle at which to start reading the arc, moving in a counter-clockwise direction. Express the angle in degrees relative to the positive X-axis.
Specifies the angle at which to stop reading the arc, moving in a counter-clockwise direction. Express the angle in degrees relative to the positive X-axis.
Specifies the address of the user array in which to store the pixels from the image buffer.
Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the number of pixels found along the arc. Set this parameter to M_NULL if it is not to be evaluated.
member.returns: The returned value is the number of pixels found along the arc.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.MbufGetArc(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,System.Double,System.Double,System.Single[],System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Read the pixels along a specified arc, count the pixels, and store their values in a user-defined array.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the single-band (monochrome) source image buffer.
Specifies the X-coordinate of the ellipse center, relative to the top-left coordinate of the source buffer.
Specifies the Y-coordinate of the ellipse center, relative to the top-left coordinate of the source buffer.
Specifies the radius along the X-axis. The radius should be given in pixels and must be greater than 0.
Specifies the radius along the Y-axis. The radius should be given in pixels and must be greater than 0.

member.param: Specifies the identifier of the single-band (monochrome) source image buffer.
Specifies the X-coordinate of the ellipse center, relative to the top-left coordinate of the source buffer.
Specifies the Y-coordinate of the ellipse center, relative to the top-left coordinate of the source buffer.
Specifies the radius along the X-axis. The radius should be given in pixels and must be greater than 0.
Specifies the radius along the Y-axis. The radius should be given in pixels and must be greater than 0.
Specifies the angle at which to start reading the arc, moving in a counter-clockwise direction. Express the angle in degrees relative to the positive X-axis.
Specifies the angle at which to stop reading the arc, moving in a counter-clockwise direction. Express the angle in degrees relative to the positive X-axis.
Specifies the address of the user array in which to store the pixels from the image buffer.
Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the number of pixels found along the arc. Set this parameter to M_NULL if it is not to be evaluated.
member.returns: The returned value is the number of pixels found along the arc.

member.summary: Import data from a file into a data buffer.
member.param: Specifies the name and path of the file from which to import the data.
Specifies the file format.
Specifies the import operation.
Specifies the system on which to allocate the buffer for an M_RESTORE operation. For an M_LOAD operation, this parameter should be set to M_NULL .

Specifies the address of the variable containing the buffer identifier, for an M_LOAD operation, or the address of the variable in which to store the new buffer identifier, for an M_RESTORE operation.
member.returns: The returned value is the buffer identifier (for an M_RESTORE operation only). If allocation fails, M_NULL is returned.

Specifies the format of the file.
Specifies whether to import the specified sequence of images into automatically allocated buffers or previously allocated buffers.
Specifies the system on which to allocate the buffers for an M_RESTORE operation. In other cases, this parameter should be set to M_NULL .
Specifies the address of the array containing the buffer identifiers for an M_LOAD operation, or the address of the array in which to store the new buffer identifiers for an M_RESTORE operation.
Specifies the frame number of the image from which to begin importing.
Specifies the number of images, starting at StartImage, to import.
Specifies the function's control flag. This parameter can be set to one of the following:

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.MbufInquire(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,System.Int64,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID@)
member.summary: Inquire about a MIL data buffer setting.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the source data buffer. The buffer must have been previously allocated on the required system using a function of the Buffer module (for example, MbufAllocColor or MbufImport ).
Specifies the type of buffer setting about which to inquire.
Specifies the address in which to write the requested information.
member.returns: The returned value is the requested information, cast to aMIL_INT; if the requested information cannot be retrieved, M_ERROR is returned. For inquire types which specify that the UserVarPtr parameter must be set to the address of aMIL_INT64orMIL_DOUBLE, the return value is M_NULL .

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.McodeModel(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,System.Int64,System.Int64,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,System.Int64,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID@)
member.summary: Add, find, or delete a code model within a code context.
member.param: Specifies the code context in which to add, find, or delete the code model.
Specifies the operation to perform within the specified code context.
Specifies the code type of the code model to add or find from the code context. Note that if the Operation parameter is set to M_DELETE, set this parameter to M_NULL .
Specifies the instance of the code model to find in the context. Note that if the Operation parameter is set to M_ADD or M_DELETE, set this parameter to M_NULL .
Specifies the function's control flag. Reserved for future expansion. This parameter must be set to M_DEFAULT .
Specifies the address in which to return the code model identifier for M_ADD and M_FIND operations. For a M_DELETE operation, ModelCodeIdPtr specifies the identifier of the model to be deleted.
member.returns: The returned value is the identifier of the code model for a successful M_ADD operation; if the model could not be added, M_NULL is returned. The returned value is the identifier of the code model for a successful M_FIND operation; M_NULL is returned if no code model is found. The returned value is M_NULL for an M_DELETE operation.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.McolAlloc(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,System.Int64,System.Int64,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,System.Int64,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID@)
member.summary: Allocate a color matching context or a relative color calibration context.
member.param: Specifies the system on which to allocate the context.
Specifies the type of context.

Specifies the source color space of the context. In general, all color data required for the color operation should be the same as the source color space specified. For example, if you specify an M_RGB source color space, your color-samples ( McolDefine ) and target or source images ( McolMatch or McolTransform ) should also typically be RGB.
Specifies the context's color space profile.
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT .
Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the context identifier.
member.returns: The returned value is the context's identifier if the allocation is successful. If allocation fails, M_NULL is returned.

member.summary: Adjust a camera's lens motor to a position that produces optimum focus, or only calculate the focus quality of a specified image or an image grabbed at the current lens motor position.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the digitizer.
Specifies the identifier of the buffer that contains the image to analyze or in which to grab.
Specifies the identifier of a child buffer of the destination buffer.
Specifies the address of the user-defined function to call before each grab.

Specifies the address of the data that you want to make available to the user-defined function. When only calculating the focus indicator (that is, using the M_EVALUATE operation mode), this parameter is not used, and must be set to M_NULL .
Specifies the minimum focus position of the search.
Specifies the starting focus position of the search.
Specifies the maximum focus position of the search.
Specifies the positional increment to use in the search.
Specifies the operation mode used by this function.

Specifies the address in which to return either the focus indicator (after performing the calculation on a single image with M_EVALUATE ) or the optimum focus position (after performing the calculation on one or more images with one of the optimum focus position search strategies). If you do not want to return the focus indicator or the optimum focus position, you can set this parameter to M_NULL .

member.summary: Adjust a camera's lens motor to a position that produces optimum focus, or only calculate the focus quality of a specified image or an image grabbed at the current lens motor position.

Specifies the minimum focus position of the search.

Specifies the operation mode used by this function.

Specifies the address in which to return either the focus indicator (after performing the calculation on a single image with M_EVALUATE ) or the optimum focus position (after performing the calculation on one or more images with one of the optimum focus position search strategies). If you do not want to return the focus indicator or the optimum focus position, you can set this parameter to M_NULL .

member.summary: Set up a request to read registers of a PU.

Specifies the section of the PU's register space to access.
Specifies the offset from the start of the specified register section, from which to begin reading, in bytes. The offset must be a multiple of 4 bytes.
Specifies how many bytes of the register to read. The length must be a multiple of 4 bytes.
Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the value read from the register. This address must remain valid for the duration of the operation, otherwise a memory corruption will occur.
Specifies when the register read access must take place.

Specifies the function identifier of the PU.
Specifies the subfunction identifier of the PU.
Specifies the specific PU instance on which to hook a function if two or more instances are present in the FPGA configuration, loaded on the Processing FPGA.
Specifies the Processing FPGA event type.
Specifies the address of the function that should be called when an event occurs.
Specifies the address of the user data that you want to make available to the hook-handler function.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.MfuncAlloc(System.String,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_FUNC_FUNCTION_PTR,System.String,System.String,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,System.Int64,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID@)
member.summary: Allocate a MIL function context for your user-defined function.
member.param: Specifies the name of the user-defined function.
Specifies the number of parameters passed to the current user-defined function. Note that the number of parameters should not exceed 16.
Specifies the address of the slave function.
Specifies the name of the library file which contains the slave function's code.
Specifies the name of the slave function to export from the library file.

Specifies the opcode to use to locate the slave function when an application executes the user-defined MIL function. The slave function's opcode also serves to identify which user-defined module, if any, the user-defined function belongs to.
Specifies more information about the user-defined MIL function.

Specifies the address of the variable in which to store the MIL identifier provided for the user-defined function. Since the MfuncAlloc function also returns the MIL identifier, you can set this parameter to M_NULL .
member.returns: The returned value is the function context identifier if the allocation is successful. If allocation fails, M_NULL is returned.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.MgenLutFunction(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,System.Double,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT)
member.summary: Generate data into a LUT buffer using a specified standard mathematical function, or a specified colormap (pseudo-color palette).
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the LUT in which to generate values.
Specifies the mathematical function or colormap to use for calculations.
Specifies the constantafor the specified mathematical function, if applicable. If filling the LUT with a colormap, set this to M_DEFAULT .
Specifies the constantbfor the specified mathematical function, if applicable. If filling the LUT with a colormap, set this to M_DEFAULT .
Specifies the constantcfor the specified mathematical function, if applicable. If filling the LUT with a colormap, set this to M_DEFAULT .
Specifies the first LUT index entry for which to generate values.
Specifies the initial value ofxin the mathematical function. If filling the LUT with a colormap, set this to M_DEFAULT .
Specifies the last LUT index entry for which to generate values.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.MgenLutRamp(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,System.Double,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,System.Double)
member.summary: Generate ramp data into a LUT buffer.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the LUT in which to generate values.
Specifies the first LUT index entry for which to generate values.
Specifies the extreme value from which the increment is calculated; that is, the first LUT entry.
Specifies the last LUT index entry for which to generate values.
Specifies the extreme value from which the increment is calculated; that is, the last LUT entry.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.MgenWarpParameter(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Generate coefficients or LUTs used to warp an image.
member.param: Specifies the input buffer from which to generate coefficients or LUT entries.
Specifies the buffer in which to place generated coefficients or X-LUT entries.
Specifies the buffer in which to place Y-LUT entries.
Specifies the mode of operation.

Specifies the type of first-order polynomial warping for which to generate coefficients. If you are not generating coefficients for a first-order polynomial warping ( M_WARP_POLYNOMIAL ), set the this parameter to M_DEFAULT .
Specifies the first transform constant.
Specifies the second transform constant.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.MgraAlloc(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID@)
member.summary: Allocate a graphics context.
member.param: Specifies the system on which to allocate the graphics context.

member.returns: The returned value is the graphics context identifier if the allocation is successful. If allocation fails, M_NULL is returned.

member.summary: Perform a point-to-point arithmetic operation using multiple source images.
member.param: Specifies the data source of the first operand; this parameter must be given an image buffer identifier.
Specifies the data source of the second operand; this parameter can be given an image buffer identifier or a constant.
Specifies the data source of the third operand; this parameter can be given an image buffer identifier or a constant.
Specifies the data source of the fourth operand; this parameter must be given a constant.
Specifies the data source of the fifth operand; this parameter must be given a constant.
Specifies the identifier of the destination of the results; this parameter must be given an image buffer identifier.
Specifies the operation to perform.
Reserved for future expansion. Must be set to M_DEFAULT .

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.MimBinarize(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,System.Int64,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Perform a point-to-point binary threshold operation.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the data source of the operation.
Specifies the identifier of the destination of the results.
Specifies the condition, as well as the threshold mode to use to establish the threshold value(s) of the condition.
Specifies either the lower limit of the selected condition or the minimum value to use when establishing the threshold.
Specifies either the upper limit of the selected condition or the maximum value to use when establishing the threshold.
member.returns: When DstImageBufId is given an image buffer identifier, this function returns the specified value of the LowParam parameter. When DstImageBufId is set to M_NULL and the ConditionAndThreshMode parameter is set to one of the automatic threshold modes ( M_BIMODAL, M_TRIANGLE_BISECTION_DARK, or M_TRIANGLE_BISECTION_BRIGHT ), this function returns the automatically calculated threshold value. If the ConditionAndThreshMode parameter is set to M_PERCENTILE_VALUE, this function returns the threshold value established from the specified lower limit. When dealing with floating-point source buffers, the returned threshold is truncated to an integer value. Therefore, the returned threshold and the actual threshold used to binarize can differ.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.MmeasGetScore(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,System.Int64,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double@,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT@,System.Int64)
member.summary: Retrieves information about the specified score characteristic.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the measurement marker buffer.
Specifies the score characteristic about which to get information.
Specifies the index of the occurrence of a multiple marker. This parameter must be set to one of the following values:

Specifies the address of the variable in which to write either the characteristic's resulting value (when using M_RESULT ) or the characteristic's minimum acceptable limit, as indicated using MmeasSetScore with the Min parameter (when using M_MARKER ).

Specifies the address of the variable in which to write either the characteristic's resulting score (when using M_RESULT ) or the characteristic's lowest acceptable limit, as indicated using MmeasSetScore with the Low parameter (when using M_MARKER ).

Specifies the address of the variable in which to write either the greatest value that MIL considers theoretically possible for the characteristic (when using M_RESULT ) or the characteristic's highest acceptable limit, as indicated using MmeasSetScore with the High parameter (when using M_MARKER ).

Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the characteristic's maximum acceptable limit, as indicated using MmeasSetScore with the Max parameter (when using M_MARKER ); otherwise, you must specify M_NULL , indicating that MIL does not return any information to this parameter (when using M_RESULT ).

Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the characteristic's score-offset, as indicated using MmeasSetScore with the ScoreOffset parameter (when using M_MARKER ); otherwise, you must specify M_NULL , indicating that MIL does not return any information to this parameter (when using M_RESULT ).

Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the characteristic's input units, as indicated using MmeasSetScore with the InputUnits parameter (when using M_MARKER ); otherwise, you must specify M_NULL , indicating that MIL does not return any information to this parameter (when using M_RESULT ).
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT .

member.summary: Allocate an OCR font context.
member.param: Specifies the system on which to allocate the OCR font context.
Specifies the OCR font context type and the type of its font.
Specifies how many characters can be stored in the OCR font context. The maximum number of characters supported is 256.
Specifies the width of the characters in the OCR font context, in pixels.
Specifies the height of the characters in the OCR font context, in pixels.
Specifies the distance between the edge of each character and their surrounding cell, along the X-axis, in pixels.
Specifies the distance between the edge of each character and their surrounding cell, along the Y-axis, in pixels.
Specifies the width of the widest character in the font without its surrounding cell, in pixels.
Specifies the height of the tallest character in the font without its surrounding cell, in pixels.
Specifies the maximum thickness (stroke width) of the characters in the OCR font context, in pixels.
Specifies the maximum length of the string that can be read or verified using the OCR font context.
Specifies whether the characters are brighter than the background.
Specifies the address of the variable to which the OCR font context identifier is to be written.
member.returns: The returned value is the OCR font context identifier if the allocation is successful. If allocation fails, M_NULL is returned.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.MocrCalibrateFont(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,System.String,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int64)
member.summary: Calibrate the OCR font context's character size and target spacing to match the characters in a sample target image.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the sample target image buffer.
Specifies the identifier of the OCR font context to be calibrated.
Specifies the character string present in the sample target image. This string must be null-terminated.
Specifies the minimum width of the characters in the sample target image, in pixels.
Specifies the maximum width of the characters in the sample target image, in pixels.

Specifies the increment to use when searching for the character width between TargetCharSizeXMin and TargetCharSizeXMax . Note that very small step sizes should only be used within small ranges, otherwise application performance can be adversely affected.
Specifies the minimum height of the characters in the sample target image, in pixels.
Specifies the maximum height of the characters in the sample target image, in pixels.

Specifies the increment to use when searching for the character height between TargetCharSizeYMin and TargetCharSizeYMax . Note that very small step sizes should only be used within small ranges, otherwise application performance can be adversely affected.
Specifies the operation to be performed.

member.summary: Draw specific features of OCR fonts or OCR result occurrences in an image buffer or graphics list.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the graphics context to use when drawing. This parameter must be set to one of the following values:

Specifies the OCR Font context or result buffer from which to extract the features to draw. The OCR Font context or result buffer must have been previously allocated using MocrAllocFont or MocrAllocResult .
Specifies the identifier of the destination image buffer or graphics list in which to draw.
Specifies the type of operation to perform.
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT .
Specifies a string containing a list of valid characters to draw when drawing an OCR font. To draw all the characters in the font or to draw results, this parameter should be set to M_NULL .
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT .

Specifies the identifier of the destination image buffer or graphics list in which to draw.
Specifies the type of operation to perform.
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT .
Specifies a string containing a list of valid characters to draw when drawing an OCR font. To draw all the characters in the font or to draw results, this parameter should be set to M_NULL .

member.summary: Automatically allocate unique pattern matching models of the specified type, from a source image.
member.param: Specifies the system on which to allocate the models.
Specifies the identifier of the image buffer from which to extract the models.
Specifies the width of the required models.
Specifies the height of the required models.

Specifies the maximum displacement (shift) expected between the reference position of the models in the source image and their position when found in the target images in the vertical direction.
Specifies the type of the model.
Specifies the speed of the allocation process.
Specifies the address of the array in which to write the model identifiers.
member.returns: The returned value is the model identifier if the allocation is successful. If allocation fails, M_NULL is returned.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.MregDraw(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,System.Int64,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,System.Int64)
member.summary: Draw specific features of the registration results in an image buffer or graphics list.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the graphics context to use when drawing. This parameter must be set to one of the following value. Note that while this parameter is required for calling MregDraw, when using an M_EXTENDED_DEPTH_OF_FIELD_RESULT result buffer, this parameter will not affect the function.
Specifies the identifier of the registration result buffer from which to extract the results to draw.
Specifies the identifier of the destination image buffer or graphics list in which to draw.
Specifies the type of operation to perform. This parameter can be set to one of the following:
Specifies the registration element that is associated with the image whose features you want to draw when drawing results of an M_STITCHING_RESULT registration result buffer.
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT .

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.MsysIoCommandRegister(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int64,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT@)
member.summary: Add a command to change the state of a bit of the I/O command register at a specified time or counter value.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the I/O command list in which to add a command.
Specifies the command to add to the I/O command list to change the state of the specified I/O command register bit.
Specifies the reference time or counter value to which the delay is added.
Specifies the delay to add to the reference time or counter value; the sum of the two establishes the specific moment that the command is executed.
Specifies the duration of the pulse if the command specified with Operation is M_PULSE_HIGH or M_PULSE_LOW .
Specifies the bit of the I/O command register to affect with the command.
Specifies the address in which to write whether the command was successfully added to the list.
member.returns: The returned value is M_NULL if the function successfully scheduled the command, M_INVALID if the moment at which to execute the command had elapsed when the function was executed, and M_UNKNOWN if the function encountered an error or if the CommandStatusPtr parameter was set to M_NULL .

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.MthrWait(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,System.Int64,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT@)
member.summary: Perform a wait operation on a MIL thread or event.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the MIL thread context or event with which to be synchronized.
Specifies the wait option.
Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the state of the specified thread or event.
member.returns: The returned value for M_THREAD_END_WAIT, M_THREAD_WAIT, and M_EVENT_WAIT is M_SIGNALED if the specified thread has successfully completed or if the state of the specified event has changed; it is M_TIMEOUT if the thread or event on which the current thread was waiting timed out. For M_EVENT_SYNCHRONIZE, the returned value is M_UNKNOWN .

For M_EVENT_SYNCHRONIZE, the returned value is M_UNKNOWN .

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.MthrWaitMultiple(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID@,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,System.Int64,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT@)
member.summary: Perform a wait operation on multiple MIL events.
member.param: Specifies the address of a user-supplied array that contains the identifiers of the MIL events for which to wait.
Specifies the number of events in the user-supplied array.
Specifies the wait option.
Specifies the address in which to write the returned value.
member.returns: The returned value for M_EVENT_WAIT is the index of the event that changed to the M_SIGNALED state, or M_TIMEOUT if none of the events in the array changed state before the time out interval is reached. For M_EVENT_WAIT + M_ALL_OBJECTS, the returned value is M_SIGNALED if all the events specified in the array changed state, or M_TIMEOUT if the time out interval is reached before all the events in the array have changed state. For M_EVENT_SYNCHRONIZE, the returned value is M_UNKNOWN .

member.summary: Generate a depth map image and, optionally, an intensity map image from data stored in a 3D reconstruction result buffer.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the result buffer which contains the laser line data.
Specifies the identifier of the image buffer in which to store the depth map. The image buffer must be a 1-band, 8-bit or 16-bit unsigned buffer.
Specifies the identifier of the intensity image buffer.
Specifies the type of operation to perform.
Specifies the point cloud(s) in the specified 3D reconstruction result buffer from which to create a fully corrected depth map.
Reserved for future expansion. This parameter must be set to M_DEFAULT .

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.M3dmapFree(System.Int64)
member.summary: Free a 3D reconstruction context, a 3D reconstruction result buffer, or a geometry object.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the 3D reconstruction context, 3D reconstruction result buffer, or geometry object to free.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.M3dmapGet(System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Int64@)
member.summary: Retrieve the world coordinates and intensity of each of the points in one or more point clouds.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the 3D reconstruction result buffer from which to retrieve the points or features. The 3D reconstruction result buffer must have been previously allocated with M3dmapAllocResult using M_POINT_CLOUD_CONTAINER .
Specifies the point cloud(s) in the specified 3D reconstruction result buffer.
Specifies the feature to retrieve from the point cloud(s).
Specifies options for the function.
Specifies a combination of two values: the depth and type of the arrays.
Specifies the maximum number of elements that the output arrays can hold.
Specifies the address of an array in which to store the first coordinates of the feature to retrieve.
Specifies the address of an array in which to store the second coordinates of the feature to retrieve.
Specifies the address of an array in which to store the third coordinates of the feature to retrieve.
Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the number of elements written in each of the output arrays ( Coord1OrPackedArrayPtr, Coord2ArrayPtr, and Coord3ArrayPtr ).
member.returns: The returned value is the number of elements to be written in each of the output arrays, regardless of whether the arrays provided are big enough to actually write the elements. When using M_NO_INVALID_POINT, this is the number of elements after filtering out the invalid points.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.M3dmapRestore(System.String,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64@)
member.summary: Restore a 3D reconstruction context or geometry object from disk.
member.param: Specifies the name and directory of the file from which to restore the 3D reconstruction context or geometry object.
Specifies the system on which to restore the 3D reconstruction context or geometry object.
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT .

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.M3dmapTriangulate(System.Int64[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Triangulate the 3D world coordinates of points from their pixel location in the image plane of two or more cameras.
member.param: Specifies the address of an array containing the identifiers of the camera calibration contexts for each of the camera setups.
Specifies the address of the array containing the X-pixel coordinates of the common points in the image plane of each camera.
Specifies the address of the array containing the Y-pixel coordinates of the common points in the image plane of each camera. This array must have a size equal to ( NumCalibrations x NumPoints ).
Specifies the address of an array in which to write the calculated X-world coordinates.
Specifies the address of the array in which to write the calculated Y-world coordinates.
Specifies the address of the array in which to write the calculated Z-world coordinates.
Specifies the address of the array in which to write the root mean square (RMS) error for the calculated world coordinates of each point.
Specifies the number of calibration contexts. This should correspond to the number of cameras. This parameter must be greater or equal to 2.
Specifies the number of points to compute using triangulation. This parameter must be greater or equal to 1.
Specifies the world coordinate system that is common to all the specified camera calibration contexts.
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT .

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MbeadDraw(System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Draw specific features of a bead context or of a bead result.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the graphics context to use. This parameter must be set to one of the following values:

Specifies the identifier of the bead context or bead result buffer that this function will use to perform the drawing operation. The context or result buffer must have been previously allocated on the system using MbeadAlloc or MbeadAllocResult, respectively.
Specifies the identifier of the destination image buffer or graphics list in which to draw.
Specifies the drawing operation to perform.
Specifies the type of points that this function will use to perform the drawing operation.
Specifies the templates (one or all) that this function will use to perform the drawing operation, or specifies that you are performing a general type of drawing operation.
Specifies the set of template points (one or all) for which to perform the drawing operation, or specifies that you are performing a general type of drawing operation.
Specifies whether MIL performs drawings with fail-type points differently than drawings with other types of points.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MbeadFree(System.Int64)
member.summary: Free a bead context or a bead result buffer.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the bead context or bead result buffer to free. These must have been successfully allocated (with MbeadAlloc or MbeadAllocResult ) prior to calling this function.

member.summary: Train the templates in a bead context.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the bead context that contains the templates to train.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MbeadVerify(System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Verify beads in the target image according to their corresponding template.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the bead context that contains the templates with which to validate the beads in the target image.

Specifies the identifier of the target image buffer that contains the beads that must be verified, according the templates contained within the bead context. The image buffer must be a 1-band 8-bit unsigned buffer.
Specifies the identifier of the bead result buffer in which to write the results of the verification.
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT .

member.summary: Allocate a blob analysis feature list.
member.param: Specifies the system on which to allocate the feature list.
Specifies the address of the variable in which the feature list identifier will be written.
member.returns: The returned value is the feature list identifier if the allocation is successful. If allocation fails, M_NULL is returned.

member.summary: Allocate a blob analysis result buffer.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MblobCalculate(System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Perform blob analysis calculations.
member.param: Specifies the blob identifier image that will be used in calculations.
Specifies the grayscale image (not a binary buffer) that will be used to calculate grayscale features.
Specifies the identifier of the feature list buffer, previously allocated with MblobAllocFeatureList, that specifies the feature(s) to calculate.
Specifies the identifier of a blob analysis result buffer, previously allocated with MblobAllocResult, in which to store calculated results.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MblobDraw(System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Draw specific blob features in the destination image buffer or graphics list.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the graphics context to use when drawing. This parameter must be set to one of the following values:
Specifies the identifier of the blob analysis result buffer from which to retrieve the features to draw.
Specifies the identifier of the destination image buffer or graphics list in which to draw.
Specifies the type of operation to perform.
Specifies the label of the blob or blobs to draw.
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT .

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MblobFill(System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Draw blobs that meet a specified fill criterion.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the blob analysis result buffer.
Specifies the identifier of the destination image buffer.
Specifies which blobs to draw with the specified value.
Specifies the value with which to fill the blobs that meet the specified criterion. If the destination buffer is binary, this value must be 0 or 1.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MblobFree(System.Int64)
member.summary: Free the blob analysis result buffer or the feature list.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the blob analysis result buffer or feature list buffer to free. The buffer must have been successfully allocated, using MblobAllocResult or MblobAllocFeatureList, prior to calling this function.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MblobGetLabel(System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64@)
member.summary: Get the label value of a blob at a specified position.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the blob analysis result buffer where the labels are stored. Note, this function cannot obtain the label values of blobs that have been deleted from the result buffer with MblobSelect .
Specifies the X-coordinate of the blob.
Specifies the Y-coordinate of the blob.

Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the label value. If there is no blob at the specified location, the blob has been deleted, or if the blob's XPos and YPos lie outside the original identifier image, M_NULL is returned instead of the label value. Also, since MblobGetLabel returns the label value, you can set this parameter to M_NULL .
member.returns: The returned value is the label value of the specified blob.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MblobGetLabel(System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.IntPtr)

Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the label value. If there is no blob at the specified location, the blob has been deleted, or if the blob's XPos and YPos lie outside the original identifier image, M_NULL is returned instead of the label value. Also, since MblobGetLabel returns the label value, you can set this parameter to M_NULL .
member.returns: The returned value is the label value of the specified blob.

Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the count. Since MblobGetNumber also returns the number of selected blobs, you can set this parameter to M_NULL .
member.returns: The returned value is the number of included blobs in the specified result buffer.

member.summary: Get the blob run-length encoding information.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the blob analysis result buffer.

member.param: Specifies the MIL system on which to create the buffer.
Specifies the number of (x,y) surfaces (also called color bands) that the buffer should have to contain each color component of the data.
Specifies the buffer width.
Specifies the buffer height.
Specifies a combination of two values: data depth and data type, per band.
Specifies the buffer usage.
Specifies the physical nature of the buffer.
Specifies the size of the pitch.
Specifies one or more data pointers that address the memory to which to map the created MIL buffer.
Specifies the address of the variable in which the buffer identifier is to be written.
member.returns: The returned value is the buffer identifier. If allocation fails, M_NULL is returned.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MbufDiskInquire(System.String,System.Int64,System.Int64@)
member.summary: Inquire about the data in a file.
member.param: Specifies the file that contains the data.
Specifies the type of file setting about which to inquire.
Specifies the address in which to write the requested information.
member.returns: The returned value is the requested information about the buffer data in the specified file, cast to aMIL_INT. If the requested information is not available, M_INVALID is returned. If an AVI file is specified but its codec is not known, M_AVI_CODEC_UNSUPPORTED is returned.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MbufExportSequence(System.String,System.Int64,System.Int64@,System.Int64,System.Double,System.Int64)
member.summary: Export a sequence of image buffers to an AVI file.
member.param: Specifies the name and path of the AVI file.
Specifies the format of the file.
Specifies the image buffers to export or, when opening or closing ( M_OPEN, M_OPEN + M_APPEND, or M_CLOSE ) a file on a remote computer, a MIL system allocated on the remote computer.
Specifies the number of MIL identifiers passed to the BufArrayPtrOrSystemIdPtr parameter (image buffers or system identifiers).
Specifies the frame rate (number of images/sec) of the sequence.
Specifies whether to write, overwrite, or append the image buffers to the AVI file.

member.summary: Read the pixels along a specified arc, count the pixels, and store their values in a user-defined array.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the single-band (monochrome) source image buffer.
Specifies the X-coordinate of the ellipse center, relative to the top-left coordinate of the source buffer.
Specifies the Y-coordinate of the ellipse center, relative to the top-left coordinate of the source buffer.

Specifies the address of the user array in which to store the pixels from the image buffer.
Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the number of pixels found along the arc. Set this parameter to M_NULL if it is not to be evaluated.
member.returns: The returned value is the number of pixels found along the arc.

member.param: Specifies the identifier of the single-band (monochrome) source image buffer.
Specifies the X-coordinate of the ellipse center, relative to the top-left coordinate of the source buffer.
Specifies the Y-coordinate of the ellipse center, relative to the top-left coordinate of the source buffer.
Specifies the radius along the X-axis. The radius should be given in pixels and must be greater than 0.
Specifies the radius along the Y-axis. The radius should be given in pixels and must be greater than 0.
Specifies the angle at which to start reading the arc, moving in a counter-clockwise direction. Express the angle in degrees relative to the positive X-axis.
Specifies the angle at which to stop reading the arc, moving in a counter-clockwise direction. Express the angle in degrees relative to the positive X-axis.
Specifies the address of the user array in which to store the pixels from the image buffer.
Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the number of pixels found along the arc. Set this parameter to M_NULL if it is not to be evaluated.
member.returns: The returned value is the number of pixels found along the arc.

member.param: Specifies the name and path of the file from which to import the data.
Specifies the file format.
Specifies the import operation.
Specifies the system on which to allocate the buffer for an M_RESTORE operation. For an M_LOAD operation, this parameter should be set to M_NULL .

member.returns: The returned value is the buffer identifier (for an M_RESTORE operation only). If allocation fails, M_NULL is returned.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MbufInquire(System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64@)
member.summary: Inquire about a MIL data buffer setting.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the source data buffer. The buffer must have been previously allocated on the required system using a function of the Buffer module (for example, MbufAllocColor or MbufImport ).
Specifies the type of buffer setting about which to inquire.
Specifies the address in which to write the requested information.
member.returns: The returned value is the requested information, cast to aMIL_INT; if the requested information cannot be retrieved, M_ERROR is returned. For inquire types which specify that the UserVarPtr parameter must be set to the address of aMIL_INT64orMIL_DOUBLE, the return value is M_NULL .

member.summary: Inquire about a MIL data buffer setting.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the source data buffer. The buffer must have been previously allocated on the required system using a function of the Buffer module (for example, MbufAllocColor or MbufImport ).
Specifies the type of buffer setting about which to inquire.
Specifies the address in which to write the requested information.
member.returns: The returned value is the requested information, cast to aMIL_INT; if the requested information cannot be retrieved, M_ERROR is returned. For inquire types which specify that the UserVarPtr parameter must be set to the address of aMIL_INT64orMIL_DOUBLE, the return value is M_NULL .

member.param: Specifies the identifier of the calibration context.

Specifies the X-position of the top-left circle of the calibration grid of circles or the top-left point connecting four squares in a chessboard grid. Specify its X-position in the calibration-plane coordinate system, in world-units.

Specifies the Y-position of the top-left circle of the calibration grid of circles or the top-left point connecting four squares in a chessboard grid. Specify its Y-position in the calibration-plane coordinate system in, world-units.

Specifies the Z-position of the top-left circle of the calibration grid of circles or the top-left point connecting four squares in a chessboard grid. Specify its Z-position in the calibration-plane coordinate system in, world-units.
Specifies the number of rows in the calibration grid.
Specifies the number of columns in the calibration grid.
Specifies the number of world units between rows.
Specifies the number of world units between columns.
Specifies the calibration operation to perform.
Specifies the type of grid used.

member.summary: Change the origin and/or orientation of the relative coordinate system.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the calibration context or calibrated image.

Specifies the Y-offset of the relative coordinate system origin from the reference coordinate system, in world-units.
Specifies the Z-offset of the relative coordinate system origin from the reference coordinate system, in world-units.

Specifies the mode of transformation and how to deal with invalid points.

Specifies the result to convert at the specified position. This result must be of the type specified using ResultType .
Specifies the address in which to place the converted result.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.McalUniform(System.Int64,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int64)
member.summary: Calibrate an image or a calibration context by specifying the translation, scale and offset of the absolute world coordinate system.

Specifies the Y-position in the absolute coordinate system of the center of the top-left pixel of the image.
Specifies the scale between the world and pixel units in the X-direction.
Specifies the scale between the world and pixel units in the Y-direction.
Specifies the angle of the X-axis of the pixel coordinate system measured in the absolute coordinate system, in degrees.
Specifies the function's control flag.

Specifies the LUT buffer from which source Y-coordinates are determined.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.McodeModel(System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64@)
member.summary: Add, find, or delete a code model within a code context.
member.param: Specifies the code context in which to add, find, or delete the code model.
Specifies the operation to perform within the specified code context.
Specifies the code type of the code model to add or find from the code context. Note that if the Operation parameter is set to M_DELETE, set this parameter to M_NULL .
Specifies the instance of the code model to find in the context. Note that if the Operation parameter is set to M_ADD or M_DELETE, set this parameter to M_NULL .
Specifies the function's control flag. Reserved for future expansion. This parameter must be set to M_DEFAULT .
Specifies the address in which to return the code model identifier for M_ADD and M_FIND operations. For a M_DELETE operation, ModelCodeIdPtr specifies the identifier of the model to be deleted.
member.returns: The returned value is the identifier of the code model for a successful M_ADD operation; if the model could not be added, M_NULL is returned. The returned value is the identifier of the code model for a successful M_FIND operation; M_NULL is returned if no code model is found. The returned value is M_NULL for an M_DELETE operation.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.McodeModel(System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.IntPtr)

Specifies the function's control flag. Reserved for future expansion. This parameter must be set to M_DEFAULT .
Specifies the address in which to return the code model identifier for M_ADD and M_FIND operations. For a M_DELETE operation, ModelCodeIdPtr specifies the identifier of the model to be deleted.
member.returns: The returned value is the identifier of the code model for a successful M_ADD operation; if the model could not be added, M_NULL is returned. The returned value is the identifier of the code model for a successful M_FIND operation; M_NULL is returned if no code model is found. The returned value is M_NULL for an M_DELETE operation.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.McolAlloc(System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64@)
member.summary: Allocate a color matching context or a relative color calibration context.
member.param: Specifies the system on which to allocate the context.
Specifies the type of context.

Specifies the source color space of the context. In general, all color data required for the color operation should be the same as the source color space specified. For example, if you specify an M_RGB source color space, your color-samples ( McolDefine ) and target or source images ( McolMatch or McolTransform ) should also typically be RGB.
Specifies the context's color space profile.
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT .
Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the context identifier.
member.returns: The returned value is the context's identifier if the allocation is successful. If allocation fails, M_NULL is returned.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.McolAlloc(System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Allocate a color matching context or a relative color calibration context.
member.param: Specifies the system on which to allocate the context.
Specifies the type of context.

Specifies the source color space of the context. In general, all color data required for the color operation should be the same as the source color space specified. For example, if you specify an M_RGB source color space, your color-samples ( McolDefine ) and target or source images ( McolMatch or McolTransform ) should also typically be RGB.
Specifies the context's color space profile.
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT .
Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the context identifier.
member.returns: The returned value is the context's identifier if the allocation is successful. If allocation fails, M_NULL is returned.

member.summary: Transform color data using relative color calibration.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the relative color calibration context containing the color-sample and its associated mapping.

Specifies the index or label of a color-sample in the specified relative color calibration context. McolTransform uses the mapping associated with the specified color-sample to transform the color of the source image.
Specifies the identifier of the source image with which to perform the relative color calibration.
Specifies the identifier of destination image in which to write the transformed color.
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT .

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MdigFocus(System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_FOCUS_HOOK_FUNCTION_PTR,System.IntPtr,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64@)
member.summary: Adjust a camera's lens motor to a position that produces optimum focus, or only calculate the focus quality of a specified image or an image grabbed at the current lens motor position.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the digitizer.
Specifies the identifier of the buffer that contains the image to analyze or in which to grab.
Specifies the identifier of a child buffer of the destination buffer.
Specifies the address of the user-defined function to call before each grab.

Specifies the address of the data that you want to make available to the user-defined function. When only calculating the focus indicator (that is, using the M_EVALUATE operation mode), this parameter is not used, and must be set to M_NULL .
Specifies the minimum focus position of the search.
Specifies the starting focus position of the search.
Specifies the maximum focus position of the search.
Specifies the positional increment to use in the search.
Specifies the operation mode used by this function.

Specifies the address in which to return either the focus indicator (after performing the calculation on a single image with M_EVALUATE ) or the optimum focus position (after performing the calculation on one or more images with one of the optimum focus position search strategies). If you do not want to return the focus indicator or the optimum focus position, you can set this parameter to M_NULL .

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MfuncAlloc(System.String,System.Int64,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_FUNC_FUNCTION_PTR,System.String,System.String,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64@)
member.summary: Allocate a MIL function context for your user-defined function.
member.param: Specifies the name of the user-defined function.
Specifies the number of parameters passed to the current user-defined function. Note that the number of parameters should not exceed 16.
Specifies the address of the slave function.
Specifies the name of the library file which contains the slave function's code.
Specifies the name of the slave function to export from the library file.

Specifies the opcode to use to locate the slave function when an application executes the user-defined MIL function. The slave function's opcode also serves to identify which user-defined module, if any, the user-defined function belongs to.
Specifies more information about the user-defined MIL function.

Specifies the address of the variable in which to store the MIL identifier provided for the user-defined function. Since the MfuncAlloc function also returns the MIL identifier, you can set this parameter to M_NULL .
member.returns: The returned value is the function context identifier if the allocation is successful. If allocation fails, M_NULL is returned.

Specifies the address of the variable in which to store the MIL identifier provided for the user-defined function. Since the MfuncAlloc function also returns the MIL identifier, you can set this parameter to M_NULL .
member.returns: The returned value is the function context identifier if the allocation is successful. If allocation fails, M_NULL is returned.

Specifies the data source of the second operand; this parameter can be given an image buffer identifier or a constant.
Specifies the data source of the third operand; this parameter can be given an image buffer identifier or a constant.
Specifies the data source of the fourth operand; this parameter must be given a constant.
